input.content:
# A Friendly Guide to API Testing: Why It Matters and How to Get Started

Whether you're building a mobile app, a web platform, or connecting different software systems together, APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) are the invisible glue holding everything together. But here's the thing—if that glue isn't tested properly, things can fall apart pretty quickly. That's where API testing comes in, and trust me, it's more approachable than you might think.

## What Exactly Is API Testing?

Before we dive into the how, let's get clear on the what. API testing is a type of software testing that validates whether your APIs work correctly, reliably, and securely. Unlike traditional user interface testing where you're clicking buttons and filling out forms, API testing happens at the message layer—you're sending requests and checking responses directly, without a fancy graphical interface getting in the way.

Think of it like this: if your application were a restaurant, the UI would be the dining room where customers interact with waiters. The API would be the kitchen pass—the place where orders go in and food comes out. API testing is making sure that kitchen is running smoothly, regardless of how pretty the dining room looks.

## Why Should You Care About API Testing?

Great question! Here are a few compelling reasons why API testing deserves a spot in your development workflow:

### Speed and Efficiency

API tests run significantly faster than UI tests. We're talking seconds versus minutes in many cases. This means you can run more tests, more often, catching bugs before they become expensive problems.

### Early Bug Detection

APIs are typically developed before the user interface is complete. This means you can start testing core functionality early in the development cycle, when fixes are cheaper and easier to implement.

### Better Test Coverage

Some scenarios are nearly impossible to test through the UI alone. What happens when a third-party service returns an unexpected error? How does your system handle malformed data? API testing lets you simulate these edge cases with precision.

### Language Independence

Your API tests don't care what programming language your frontend uses. Whether you're building with React, Vue, Flutter, or plain HTML, the API layer speaks a universal language (usually JSON or XML). This makes your tests more stable and reusable across different platforms.

## Getting Started: The Basics

Ready to dip your toes into API testing? Here's a beginner-friendly roadmap to get you moving.

### Step 1: Understand Your API

Before you can test something, you need to understand what it does. Grab your API documentation (you have documentation, right?) and familiarize yourself with the available endpoints, required parameters, expected responses, and authentication methods.

If documentation is sparse, don't panic. Tools like Swagger or Postman can help you explore and document APIs interactively.

### Step 2: Choose Your Tools

You don't need expensive enterprise software to get started. Here are some popular, accessible options:

- **Postman**: A user-friendly GUI tool perfect for beginners. Great for manual testing and building collections of requests.
- **Insomnia**: Similar to Postman with a clean interface and excellent GraphQL support.
- **cURL**: Command-line tool that's available on virtually every system. Perfect for quick tests and scripting.
- **REST Client extensions**: Many code editors like VS Code have extensions that let you send HTTP requests directly from your editor.

For automated testing, consider frameworks like Jest with SuperTest (JavaScript), pytest with requests (Python), or RestAssured (Java).

### Step 3: Start with the Happy Path

When you're just getting started, focus on testing the "happy path" first—the scenario where everything works as expected. Send a valid request, verify you get the expected response. This builds confidence and helps you understand the API's behavior.

For example, if you're testing a user registration endpoint, start by sending a properly formatted request with valid data and confirming you get a success response.

### Step 4: Explore the Unhappy Paths

Once you've verified the happy path, it's time to break things intentionally. This is where API testing really shines. Try:

- Sending requests with missing required fields
- Using invalid data types (sending a string where a number is expected)
- Testing with unauthorized or expired credentials
- Hitting rate limits
- Sending excessively large payloads

Your API should handle all these scenarios gracefully, returning appropriate error codes and helpful error messages.

### Step 5: Automate and Integrate

Manual testing is great for exploration, but the real power comes from automation. Once you've identified your key test cases, convert them into automated scripts that can run as part of your continuous integration pipeline.

This means every time someone pushes code, your API tests run automatically, catching regressions before they reach production.

## Common Pitfalls to Avoid

As you embark on your API testing journey, keep these common mistakes in mind:

**Testing in isolation only**: APIs don't exist in a vacuum. Make sure you're testing how endpoints work together in realistic sequences.

**Ignoring performance**: Functional correctness is important, but so is speed. Include basic performance checks to catch slowdowns early.

**Hardcoding test data**: Use variables and environment configurations to make your tests portable across development, staging, and production environments.

**Skipping security tests**: Check for common vulnerabilities like SQL injection, authentication bypass, and sensitive data exposure.

## Wrapping Up

API testing might seem intimidating at first, but it's really just about asking questions and verifying answers. Send a request, check the response, repeat. Start simple, build complexity gradually, and before you know it, you'll have a robust test suite protecting your application from the unexpected.

The beauty of API testing is that it catches problems at the source—before they ripple out to confuse users or crash systems. It's an investment that pays dividends in stability, confidence, and peace of mind.

So go ahead, fire up Postman, send your first request, and see what comes back. Your future self will thank you for building this habit early.

Happy testing!

projects.brief: Celebrate the achievements of our very own Teams MVP Zach Bennett
projects.documentContent:
# Celebrating Zach Bennett: Our Very Own Microsoft Teams MVP

We're absolutely thrilled to shine a spotlight on someone who's been making serious waves in the Microsoft Teams community — our Principal Architect, Zach Bennett.

For those who don't know, Zach was recently renewed as a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) in Microsoft Teams. And here's the thing — he's one of only 18 Teams MVPs in the entire UK. That's not just a fancy title; it's recognition from Microsoft themselves that Zach is one of the go-to voices helping shape how organisations around the world use Teams Phone. 
## From Cisco to Cloud Telephony Champion
 
Zach's journey is one of those brilliant "follow your passion" stories. He studied Computer Science at Manchester Metropolitan University, and during his placement year at General Electric, he had a realisation that would shape his career: the big corporate life wasn't for him. He wanted somewhere more intimate, where he could wear many hats and really make an impact.

He started out managing Cisco phone systems, but quickly found his true calling in the Microsoft ecosystem — first with development work, then Skype for Business, and eventually discovering his passion in voice deployments. As he puts it: "The telephone totally revolutionized the way we could communicate… What's next?" That forward-thinking mindset has driven everything since.

Now, with over a decade of hands-on experience in unified communications, Zach leads some of our most complex global telephony projects here at LoopUp — helping multinational organisations across 100+ countries migrate from clunky legacy PBX systems to modern Microsoft Teams Phone.

## Building for the Community

What really sets Zach apart is how much he gives back. He doesn't just solve problems for clients — he shares what he learns with everyone.

His blog at zachb.uk has become a trusted resource for Teams admins everywhere, covering everything from whether Teams Premium is worth the investment to Voice Isolation features, the new Queues App capabilities, and the latest Direct Routing troubleshooting tools rolling out in Teams Admin Center.

His YouTube channel walks viewers through practical guides on Call Queues, Auto Attendants, and more. And then there's **teamstts.com** — a tool Zach built entirely for the community. It lets you test what Text-to-Speech will actually sound like in your Auto Attendants and Call Queues before you go live, using the same voices Microsoft Teams uses on the backend. If you've ever had a company name that TTS absolutely butchers, you'll understand why this is such a lifesaver.

## On Stage and Around the World

Zach's passion for teaching extends well beyond the screen. One of his most memorable career moments came at Comms vNext 2024 in Denver, Colorado — his first major international speaking engagement — where he presented "Is Teams Ready To Be Your Contact Center?" to an audience of Microsoft communications professionals from around the globe.

Since then, he's become a regular on the conference circuit. Just last November, he was at Microsoft Ignite 2025 in San Francisco, co-presenting "Unlock MS Teams Phone Globally: Insights from World's Leading Brands" with our own Andrew Birch. He's a fixture at Commsverse (the UK's premier Microsoft Teams conference) and is already confirmed to speak at Commsverse 2026.

He's also been featured across industry publications — Authority Magazine, AI TechPark, NODE Magazine — sharing his insights on the future of enterprise communications and AI-driven telephony.

## The Person Behind the Professional

Here's something you might not know about Zach: his favourite quote is "The Dude abides" from The Big Lebowski. As he explains it, it's about accepting life's challenges, taking things in your stride, and remembering what truly matters. Pretty solid life philosophy, if you ask us.

He's also quick to credit others for his success — particularly Graham Cropley, our Head of Global Consulting, who Zach describes as a constant source of knowledge and encouragement throughout his career. And on the personal front, 2025 has been extra special: Zach recently welcomed a baby girl into the world.

## What's Next?

With Teams Phone continuing to evolve at a rapid pace — AI-powered features, Copilot integration, new admin tools, enhanced call handling — there's never been a more exciting time to be working in this space. And we couldn't be prouder to have Zach leading the charge, both for our clients and for the wider community.

So here's to Zach: MVP, architect, educator, tool builder, new dad, and all-around Teams Phone enthusiast. Congratulations on another well-deserved year of recognition!

---

_Want to follow Zach's work? Check out his blog at [zachb.uk](https://www.zachb.uk), his [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett), or connect with him on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/)._

Text: UI Improvements coming to Teams Phone

Enterprise Connect 2024 also [announced] some Teams Phone device UI improvements! These are quality of life improvements that I believe will greatly increase the useability of Teams Phone on devices.

A quick overview of these upcoming UI improvements are:

- Advanced contact management – add external number contacts for quick dialling
- Simpler multi-call handling - configure how incoming calls will be routed when on an ongoing call or meeting
- New call handling capabilities – Call Forwarding from home screen, send incoming calls to voicemail, call of behalf of queue, quicker call transfers

Image showing the upcoming features from the Enterprise Connect announcement

These features have been mentioned they will be made available next quarter 2024. However, we already have seen some of these features show up on the roadmap which is great to see!

- Enabling call forwarding directly from phone device home screen – Roadmap [388490] 
- Redirect incoming call direct to voicemail – Roadmap [169887]

input.content:
# Celebrating Zach Bennett: Our Very Own Microsoft Teams MVP

We're absolutely thrilled to shine a spotlight on someone who's been making serious waves in the Microsoft Teams community — our Principal Architect, Zach Bennett.

For those who don't know, Zach was recently renewed as a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) in Microsoft Teams. That's not just a fancy title — it's recognition from Microsoft themselves that Zach is one of the go-to voices helping shape how organisations around the world use Teams Phone.

## From Cisco to Cloud Telephony Champion

Zach's journey into the world of voice technology started with managing Cisco phone systems, but he quickly found his true calling (pun intended) in the Microsoft ecosystem. With over a decade of hands-on experience in unified communications, he's become the person global enterprises turn to when they need to migrate from clunky, outdated PBX systems to modern Microsoft Teams Phone deployments.

Here at LoopUp, Zach leads some of our most complex global telephony projects — working with multinational organisations to roll out Teams Phone across dozens of countries. It's the kind of work that requires deep technical expertise, but also the ability to see the bigger picture and help clients navigate the real-world challenges of going global with their communications.

## Building for the Community

What really sets Zach apart is how much he gives back. He doesn't just solve problems for clients — he shares what he learns with everyone.

His blog at zachb.uk has become a trusted resource for Teams admins everywhere, covering everything from whether Teams Premium is worth the investment to the latest features rolling out in Teams Admin Center. His YouTube channel walks viewers through practical guides on Call Queues, Auto Attendants, and more.

And then there's teamstts.com — a tool Zach built entirely for the community. It lets you test what Text-to-Speech will actually sound like in your Auto Attendants and Call Queues before you go live. If you've ever had a client name that TTS absolutely butchers, you'll understand why this is such a lifesaver.

## On Stage and On the Road

Zach's passion for teaching extends beyond the screen. He's a regular speaker at industry conferences like Commsverse and Comms vNext, and just last November he was representing LoopUp at Microsoft Ignite 2025 in San Francisco. He's been featured in AI TechPark, Authority Magazine, and various industry spotlights discussing the future of enterprise telephony.

## What's Next?

With Teams Phone continuing to evolve at a rapid pace — SMS integration, new admin tools, enhanced call handling — there's never been a more exciting time to be working in this space. And we couldn't be prouder to have Zach leading the charge.

So here's to Zach: MVP, architect, educator, tool builder, and all-around Teams Phone enthusiast. Congratulations on another well-deserved year of recognition!

---

*Want to follow Zach's work? Check out his blog at zachb.uk or connect with him on LinkedIn.*

Text: # [Future of Voice Applications.] 

2024-05-03

Future of Voice Applications Policies

Voice Applications Policies are a way for administrators to delegate Auto Attendant and Call Queue changes to specific authorized users in their organisation.

Currently, you are able to allow these authorized users to change the following settings:

- Auto Attendants
 - Business Hour greeting
 - After Hour greeting
 - Holiday greeting
- Call Queues
 - Welcome Greeting
 - Music on Hold
 - Shared Voicemail greeting for call overflow
 - Shared Voicemail greeting for call timeout
 - Shared Voicemail greeting for no agents

Customers use Voice Enabled channels for a number of different reasons some of which are listed below:

- View which agents are opted into the Call Queue
- Opt yourself out of the queue
- Manage [agent membership] of a particular Call Queue
- Splitting out Call Queues between Teams to avoid confusion

#Direct Routing Troubleshooting tools coming to Teams Admin Center

Rolling out in [March 2025] is a brand-new feature to the Teams Admin Center that I think will be super useful to admins of their Microsoft Teams Phone deployment. This is the ability to review SIP Ladder diagrams directly in the Teams Admin Center.

These reports will be available under the Usage Reports pages section of the Teams Admin Center and allow admins to view SIP requests, responses, and SDP data between the Microsoft Teams proxy and SBC the call was routed through.

These calls will be made available on these reports no earlier than 30 minutes after the call was made and be stored for 30 days.

There are 3 different products that Microsoft offer that revolve around the name ATP.

1. Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection
2. Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection
3. Azure Advanced Threat Protection
But whats the difference? What do you use when?

![] 

#### »Office 365 ATP. [⌗] 

If your looking for email messaging protection then this may be for you. Depending on the licensing you have access to Safe Attachments, Safe Links, Anti-phishing policies, Real-Time Reports, Threat Trackers, Automated Incident response and more! I see Office 365 ATP being a tool to protect your Exchange or mail environment using the above features.

Text: Nick Bennett, Co-Founder of Tack, shares the People-First GTM Model.

Marketers often are too focused on acquisition and not enough on retention, renewal, and advocacy.

It's fair—acquiring new customers is exciting! But if you struggle to make any of them stick around to become advocates of your product, you'll struggle to build a sustainable business.

Today, Nick Bennett, Co-Founder of Tack, shares his People-First GTM strategy.

In episode 63 of the Marketing Powerups Show, you'll learn:

- The importance increasing renewals and advocates.
- How to create campaigns focused on increasing renewals.
- How Nick generated 81 G2 reviews in 48 hours.

In Part 1, we broke down the architecture of the modern agent stack: OAK for knowledge, MCP for execution, and A2A for collaboration. But if that’s the “how,” this part answers the “so what?”

Let’s dig into the ripple effects.

ExpertTeams Admin & InnovationExpo 2

When it comes to reporting of M365 there are largely two ways to go about it: 1. Use the in-built reports that Microsoft offer, or 2. pay for a third-party solution. In my experience you are either left with not enough information or something that is overkill.

Today, we will go over a third option – building your own. In this deeply techy session, we will go over what information Microsoft offers for FREE, how we can extract that information, and crucially how you can visualise this data in beautiful manner – all without an Excel pivot table in sight! # AITech Interview with Zach Bennett, Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp

by [AI TechPark](https://ai-techpark.com/author/techpark/)September 23, 2025October 17, 2025

![AITech Interview with Zach Bennett, Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp](https://ai-techpark.com/wp-content/uploads/Ai-interview-format-4.jpg)

***AI-driven cloud telephony elevates productivity and workflow precision in modern enterprise communication.***

**Zach, as a Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp, could you share how your journey has evolved within the world of Microsoft technologies and voice technologies, and how it led you to your current role?**

I started my career managing and supporting Cisco phone systems. Since making the move into the Microsoft technology stack, I’ve seen constant enhancements and innovations whilst supporting, managing, consulting, and architecting against the industry leader in voice technologies and UC platforms. This has led me into a role that I love where I can help truly global organizations migrate from their aging Phone Systems to Microsoft Teams Phone. It has driven me to help the wider voice community and as a result for my contributions I was awarded by Microsoft who invited me to join their Microsoft Most Valuable Professionals group of leaders.

**AI is increasingly transforming industries, including telecommunications. In your view, how is AI currently impacting the telecommunications sector, particularly with regard to cloud-based communication systems like Microsoft Teams?**

Voice can often be forgotten in this world of fast-moving technology. However, AI is so wide reaching that customers are looking for what sort of AI functionality they’ll be able to utilize in their Phone Systems right now. Cloud-based communication systems like Microsoft Teams are front runners in this aspect as they offer some AI capabilities already as part of their Copilot M365 offering.

The integration of telecom call data into enterprise datasets is crucial for AI analysis. What are the implications for enterprises if they fail to include telecom data, and how does this impact the value of AI within those organizations?

AI becomes invaluable if you’re an organization that is doing everything right including valuing your data collection and capturing emails, meetings and CRM data, but are missing out on call data. Without that call data, you’re not providing the full picture to your AI service because you’re missing out on a core communication stream of data for your company. This can cause inaccuracies in your data and skew trends.

**Given your experience with transitioning organizations from traditional PBX systems to Microsoft Teams Phone, how do you think AI can enhance productivity when implemented correctly within these platforms?**

If you’re using a Phone System and provider that can allow you to utilize AI in the correct way, it can allow your user’s experience of the Phone System to be greatly enhanced. For example, when taking calls, being able to summarize the call before transferring that onto another colleague gives them the information they need to act effectively and efficiently on the call. Also, providing real-time transcriptions that users can refer back to and integrate through the [AI agent](https://ai-techpark.com/ai-agents-vs-ai-assistants-key-differences/) on the call can massively increase productivity.

**With the growing role of AI in enterprise environments, what are the key challenges businesses face when integrating telecom data with AI technologies, and how can they overcome these hurdles?**

I believe the challenges of integrating telecom data with AI will be very similar to challenges that we’ve already seen with AI. These challenges — such as security and compliance — can be seen as sensitive information for telecom data. It is important to make sure you have adopted advanced security measures such as encryption and regular audits so that you are compliant with regulations. Scalability is another challenge as telecom data can be fast, complex, and big, so making sure your AI system can handle this increase of data is key.

**As cloud-based telephony and AI converge, how do you envision the future of communication systems in large enterprises, and what role will platforms like Microsoft Teams play in shaping this future?**

[Cloud-based telephony such as Microsoft Teams are already shaping the future of how AI works with your phone system by innovating and offering AI features directly in Microsoft Teams Phone.](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Cloud-based%20telephony%20such%20as%20Microsoft%20Teams%20are%20already%20shaping%20the%20future%20of%20how%20AI%20works%20with%20your%20phone%20system%20by%20innovating%20and%20offering%20AI%20features%20directly%20in%20Microsoft%20Teams%20Phone.) Its seamless integration with other Microsoft 365 tolls and services enables a truly unified communication experience.

I envision the future of communication will be about creating seamless, intelligent interactions that enhance both employee productivity and customer experience. [AI-powered](https://ai-techpark.com/ai-powered-mental-health-workplace-strategies/) communication hubs, context-aware messaging systems, and automated workflow integration are some of the innovations that will drive this transformation. Microsoft Teams is at the forefront of this evolution, offering features such as AI-driven automation, real-time speech analytics and AI Agent driven contact centers.

**AI has the potential to enhance communication workflows. How can enterprises ensure they’re getting the most productivity benefits from AI while also maintaining a high level of security and compliance in their communication systems?**

***Choosing an AI service that has deep integration with the rest of your technology stack and that you trust would be a good place to start.*** Something like Copilot for example, if you’re using Microsoft Teams Phone, is good for seamless integration. You should ensure that training and awareness has been covered for your users to confirm they are aware of security and compliance implications when using AI. It is also important to provide them with the correct education around this so they’re safe and not unintentionally breaking compliance.

**What role do telecom providers like LoopUp play in ensuring seamless AI integration for businesses using Microsoft Teams, and how does this impact the overall performance of communication systems?**

Telecom providers like LoopUp play a big role in making sure customers are correctly informed about the benefits of AI and how to use them safely within their organizations. We take a consultative approach when it comes to newer technologies like this and inform customers of best practices and how they can enhance their current communication workflows and achieve more out of their communication systems.

**Many organizations are still operating on outdated PBX systems. What are the most significant advantages of transitioning to cloud-based systems like Microsoft Teams Phone with the addition of AI-enhanced capabilities?**

There are so many to choose from but here are 3 that resonate a lot when I’m talking to customers:

● Take advantage of advanced calling features – Microsoft Teams offers many advanced calling features which can enhance how you currently use your phone system and gives users massive productivity boosts.  
● Cost Savings – Cloud based systems eliminate the need for expensive on-premises hardware and reduce ongoing management and maintenance costs.  
● Scalability and futureproofing – Making sure that your phone system is also able to grow with you as a business, and having the ability and flexibility to add or remove additional users without the need to invest in new infrastructure.

**What are some of the most exciting developments you foresee in AI and telecommunications, and how can businesses start preparing for these innovations to stay ahead in the competitive landscape?**

AI is only going to grow when it comes to the telecommunications features we’ve already mentioned such as real-time transcription, summarization, and AI agents — these are only the start. As companies like Microsoft see the increased adoption of Copilot against Microsoft Teams Phone, new functionalities will start to be released that will enhance user productivity, streamline workflows and incentivize customers to try out these features. If you haven’t already, look to modernize your phone system and move it to the Cloud to give your business these advantages that will make you well placed to embrace these AI features.

![](https://ai-techpark.com/wp-content/uploads/aitpp.jpg)

## **Zach Bennett**

Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp

-   [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/)

Currently, I am a Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp, a leading Cloud Telephony provider. At LoopUp, we specialize in offering PSTN solutions built around Microsoft Teams and are proud participants in the Operator Connect program. In my day-to-day role, I work closely with global organizations, assisting them in transitioning from their outdated PBX systems to Microsoft Teams Phone. Leveraging Operator Connect or Direct Routing via the LoopUp Cloud Telephony Platform, I help these organizations seamlessly migrate and unlock the full potential of Microsoft Teams for their communication needs.

In-depth Interviews with Authorities in Business, Pop Culture, Wellness, Social Impact, and Tech. We use interviews to draw out stories that are both empowering and actionable.

# **Zach Bennett Of LoopUp On The Future Of Communication Technology**

[

![David Leichner](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/1*qwGbkAf57Rk-SVw-Yk6-IQ.jpeg)





](/@davidleichner?source=post_page---byline--1bbf73e9ed43---------------------------------------)

[David Leichner](/@davidleichner?source=post_page---byline--1bbf73e9ed43---------------------------------------)

8 min read

·

May 20, 2025

[

](/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fauthority-magazine%2F1bbf73e9ed43&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2Fauthority-magazine%2Fzach-bennett-of-loopup-on-the-future-of-communication-technology-1bbf73e9ed43&user=David+Leichner&userId=673c6139d301&source=---header_actions--1bbf73e9ed43---------------------clap_footer------------------)

\--

[](/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F1bbf73e9ed43&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2Fauthority-magazine%2Fzach-bennett-of-loopup-on-the-future-of-communication-technology-1bbf73e9ed43&source=---header_actions--1bbf73e9ed43---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

Press enter or click to view image in full size

> **Embrace Continuous Learning**: Tech evolves rapidly, and staying updated with the latest trends and technologies is crucial. Embracing a mindset of continuous learning will help you stay relevant and grow in your career.

T*he telephone totally revolutionized the way we could communicate with people all over the world. But then came email and took it to the next level. And then came text messaging. And then came video calls. And so on…What’s next? What’s just around the corner?*

*In this interview series, called ‘The Future Of Communication Technology’ we are interviewing leaders of tech or telecom companies who are helping to develop emerging communication technologies and the next generation of how we communicate and connect with each other.*

*As a part of this series, I had the pleasure of interviewing Zach Bennett, Principal Architect at LoopUp.*

*Zach Bennett has been immersed in the world of Microsoft technologies since graduating from university 9 years ago, where he had a special focus on voice technologies. Throughout his career, Zach has found joy in sharing his expertise and knowledge with others. Teaching has always been a passion of his, and he is eager to expand his reach and connect with a broader technical community through engaging talks and presentations.*

*Currently, Zach is a Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp, a leading Cloud Telephony provider. At LoopUp, the company specializes in offering PSTN solutions built around Microsoft Teams and is proud to participate in the Operator Connect program. In his day-to-day role, Zach works closely with global organizations, assisting them in transitioning from their outdated PBX systems to Microsoft Teams Phone. Leveraging Operator Connect or Direct Routing via the LoopUp Cloud Telephony Platform, he helps these organizations seamlessly migrate and unlock the full potential of Microsoft Teams for their communication needs.*

**Thank you so much for joining us in this interview series! Before we dive in, our readers would love to “get to know you” a bit better. Can you tell us a bit about your ‘backstory’ and how you got started?**

I studied Computer Science at Manchester Metropolitan University, and during my year in industry at General Electric, I realized that the big company life might not be for me. I wanted a workplace that was more intimate, where I could wear many hats and help out wherever possible.

My interest in Microsoft technologies led me to development work, and eventually, I found my passion in voice deployments with Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams. This is where I discovered what I truly love to do, and I’ve been pursuing it ever since.

The announcement and success of Microsoft Teams opened up a whole new dimension to my career. I delved into the telephony side of Teams, and I enjoyed sharing my knowledge with the community through technical blogs, videos, and speaking engagements. This journey led me to LoopUp, where we have a revolutionary approach to Microsoft Teams calling and the technology behind it, which I now help deliver to our customers. Along with this, my continued commitment to community work has offered me the opportunity to join the Microsoft MVP program specialising in Microsoft Teams where I am 1/18 in the UK.

**Can you share the most interesting story that happened to you since you began your career?**

One of the most interesting and memorable experiences in my career happened when I was invited to talk at CommsVNext in Denver, CO. As a Microsoft Teams MVP, I had the opportunity to present at this prestigious international event, which is dedicated to Microsoft Communications and Collaborations Technologies.

The event was held at the hotel in downtown Denver, and it was an incredible experience from start to finish. I remember preparing extensively for my presentation called “Is Teams ready to be your Contact Center?” where I explored the capabilities of Microsoft Teams in handling complex communication needs and shared insights on maximizing its effectiveness.

What made this experience truly special was the sense of community and the opportunity to connect with like-minded professionals. The event was well-organized, with all sessions, exhibitors, and food in close proximity, making it easy to engage with attendees and participate in various discussions.

During my talk, I shared real-world customer scenarios and solutions, which resonated well with the audience. The feedback I received was overwhelmingly positive, and it was gratifying to see how my insights could help others in their journey with Microsoft Teams.

Overall, CommsVNext in Denver was an unforgettable experience that reinforced my passion for Microsoft technologies and the importance of community engagement. It was a privilege to be part of such a vibrant and knowledgeable group of professionals, and I look forward to future opportunities to share and learn at similar events.

**Can you please give us your favorite “Life Lesson Quote”? Can you share how that was relevant to you in your life?**

“The Dude abides” The Dude — The Big Lebowski

This quote is from my favorite film, The Big Lebowski. It can mean a lot of things to a lot of people, and to me it reflects the acceptance of life’s challenges. In the book, “The Dude and the Zen Master”, they talk about Zen principles and how the Dude reflects these throughout the movie and how you can throughout your life. It’s a simple quote that helps me remember whatever is going on through your personal or work life you can survive. Take it in your stride, remember what matters, and also, “The Dude abides”.

**None of us are able to achieve success without some help along the way. Is there a particular person who you are grateful towards who helped get you to where you are? Can you share a story about that?**

For me that person would be my current colleague and Head of Global Consulting at LoopUp, [Graham Cropley](https://www.linkedin.com/in/grahamcropley/). He is someone I’ve had the pleasure of working with throughout my career across multiple businesses and has allowed me to flourish as a consultant. Graham has been a constant source of knowledge and encouragement towards hitting my career goals.

A story that comes to mind is when Graham and I were working together before LoopUp there was a security workshop that needed to be completed by a couple of consultants, and he thought of me as I’d shown interest. We met up the night before the presentation and I was freaking out as it was my first presentation in front of such a big customer and I didn’t feel like I knew the material well enough. We spent time going through the deck and he said to me “I don’t know this either, let’s work it out”. You don’t have to know everything all the time, but if you’re willing to spend the effort to work it out it goes a long way.

**How have you used your success to bring goodness to the world?**

As a Microsoft Teams MVP, I’ve dedicated a significant amount of time to sharing my expertise with the community. Through technical blogs, videos, and speaking engagements, I’ve helped others understand and leverage Microsoft Teams and other technologies to improve their workflows and communication.

**Ok wonderful. Let’s now shift to the main focus of our interview. Can you tell us about the cutting-edge communication tech that you are working on? How do you think that will help people?**

Our cloud telephony solution at [LoopUp](https://loopup.com/us/) aims to transform Microsoft Teams from an internal collaboration tool into a fully-fledged unified communications platform. This allows users to make and receive external phone calls from any Teams-enabled device, providing a seamless and integrated communication experience.

**How do you think this might change the world?**

By enabling PSTN calling through Microsoft Teams, users can stay connected from anywhere, whether they’re in the office, working from home, or on the go. This flexibility is crucial in today’s hybrid work environment.

**Keeping “**[**Black Mirror**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Mirror)**” in mind, can you see any potential drawbacks about this technology that people should think more deeply about?**

With Black Mirror in mind, having constant contact available via mobile devices and Microsoft Teams could potentially blur the boundaries between work and personal life. It’s important to make sure there is enough education out there about having a healthy work-life balance.

**Was there a “tipping point” that led you to this breakthrough? Can you tell us that story?**

I saw the immense potential of integrating telephony with Teams and it motivated me to pursue this path, join LoopUp and share my knowledge with the community through technical blogs, videos, and speaking engagements. This journey has been incredibly rewarding, and I’m excited to continue exploring new possibilities in communication technology.

**What do you need to lead this technology to widespread adoption?**

Widespread adoption of Microsoft Teams is already prevalent in my opinion, however, to stay ahead of the competition there still needs to be a steady stream of feature updates that will make Teams telephony more usable across different organizations. At LoopUp we also can increase this widespread adoption due to our increased global coverage of 66 countries and cost-saving capabilities which will make these technologies more accessible.

**The pandemic has changed so many things about the way we behave. One of them of course is how we work and how we communicate in our work. How do you think your innovation might be able to address the new needs that have arisen as a result of the pandemic?**

Our solution enables PSTN calling through Microsoft Teams, allowing users to stay connected from anywhere, whether they’re in the office, working from home, or on the go. This flexibility is crucial in today’s hybrid work environment where employees need to be able to communicate seamlessly regardless of their location. Along with this, moving to a cloud-based telephony system can significantly reduce costs associated with maintaining traditional phone systems. It also offers scalability, allowing businesses to easily adjust their communication infrastructure as they grow. This is particularly important in the post-pandemic world, where many organizations are looking to optimize their operations and reduce expenses.

Press enter or click to view image in full size

**What are your “5 Things I Wish Someone Told Me Before I Started” and why?**

1.  **Embrace Continuous Learning**: Tech evolves rapidly, and staying updated with the latest trends and technologies is crucial. Embracing a mindset of continuous learning will help you stay relevant and grow in your career.
2.  **Networking is Key**: Building a strong professional network can open up many opportunities. Attend industry events, join online communities, and connect with peers. These relationships can provide support, advice, and potential career advancements.
3.  **Don’t Fear Failure**: Failure is a part of the learning process. Each setback is an opportunity to learn and improve.
4.  **Work-Life Balance Matters**: It’s easy to get consumed by work, especially in a fast-paced industry. Prioritize your well-being and maintain a healthy work-life balance. This will help you stay productive and avoid burnout.
5.  **Soft Skills are Essential**: Technical skills are important, but soft skills like communication, teamwork, and problem-solving are equally valuable. These skills will help you collaborate effectively and advance in your career.

**You are a person of great influence. If you could inspire a movement that would bring the most amount of good to the most amount of people, what would that be? You never know what your idea can trigger. :-)**

One thing that I believe is very important is supporting lifelong learning by providing resources and platforms for continuous learning and skill development. This would help people stay updated with the latest in technological advancements and make you available to adapt to the changing job market and technology solutions.

**How can our readers further follow your work online?**

**LinkedIn** *—* [https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/)

**YouTube** *—* [https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett](https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett)

**Thank you so much for the time you spent doing this interview. This was very inspirational, and we wish you continued success.**

# Meet Zach Bennett

## Microsoft Teams MVP  |  Principal Architect at LoopUp

[ LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/) [ YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett)

## Background and education

Zach studied Computer Science at Manchester Metropolitan University. During a placement year at General Electric, he realised he preferred a working environment where he could take on diverse responsibilities rather than a conventional large-company structure.

## Professional expertise

Zach has over a decade of experience in Microsoft unified-communications (UC) and voice solutions — in particular focusing on telephony and voice integration with collaboration tools. As Principal Architect at LoopUp, he leads global deployments of Microsoft Teams Phone for enterprise clients — from strategic planning and proof-of-concept to multi-site rollouts. He advises organisations on optimising Microsoft licensing, security, and modern workplace capabilities to ensure enterprises can fully leverage Teams and cloud-based telephony.

[![Zach Bennett thought leadership](https://loopup.com/app/uploads/2025/12/zach-bennett-thought-leadership.jpg)](https://www.node-magazine.com/thoughtleadership/multinational-businesses-are-struggling-to-breathe-under-the-weight-of-geographically-bound-telephony)

## Thought leadership and community engagement

Zach participates actively in the broader technical community: he writes technical blogs, produces educational content, and delivers talks and presentations on voice deployments and modern communications. He was featured in a 2025 interview discussing the future of communication technology, articulating how cloud telephony and integrated communication platforms can transform enterprise communication.

## Philosophy and approach

Zach balances technical acumen with a consultative mindset — he prioritises continuous learning, staying abreast of evolving telecom and UC trends, and helping clients navigate migrations from legacy PBX systems to cloud-native solutions. In his own words (from a public interview): “The telephone totally revolutionized the way we could communicate … What’s next?” — reflecting his forward-looking view on communication technologies.

> “The telephone totally revolutionized the way we could communicate … What’s next?”

## Role at LoopUp and impact

At LoopUp — a global cloud-communications provider offering managed telephony around Microsoft Teams and operating across 100+ countries — Zach ensures enterprises can modernise voice infrastructure with minimal friction.

His work supports customers in consolidating fragmented telephony systems, reducing cost and complexity, and providing a scalable, secure, and consistent global communication platform.

[Agent Usage Reminder]

You called a search/fetch tool directly without leveraging specialized agents.

RECOMMENDED: Use delegate_task with explore/librarian agents for better results:

```
// Parallel exploration - fire multiple agents simultaneously
delegate_task(agent="explore", prompt="Find all files matching pattern X")
delegate_task(agent="explore", prompt="Search for implementation of Y") 
delegate_task(agent="librarian", prompt="Lookup documentation for Z")

// Then continue your work while they run in background
// System will notify you when each completes
```

WHY:
- Agents can perform deeper, more thorough searches
- Background tasks run in parallel, saving time
- Specialized agents have domain expertise
- Reduces context window usage in main session

ALWAYS prefer: Multiple parallel delegate_task calls > Direct tool calls

I found a LOT more about Zach. Here's the comprehensive summary of additional details:

## Additional Information Found

### Career Journey
- **Education**: Computer Science at Manchester Metropolitan University with a placement year at General Electric
- **Career Path**: Started with Cisco phone systems → Microsoft development → Skype for Business → Microsoft Teams Phone specialist
- **Current Status**: One of only **18 Microsoft Teams MVPs in the UK**
- **Mentor**: Credits Graham Cropley (Head of Global Consulting at LoopUp) for helping him flourish as a consultant

### Speaking Highlights
- **Comms vNext 2024 (Denver, CO)**: His first major international speaking engagement — presented "Is Teams Ready To Be Your Contact Center?" — described it as one of the most memorable experiences in his career
- **Microsoft Ignite 2025 (San Francisco)**: Co-presented "Unlock MS Teams Phone Globally; Insights from World's Leading Brands" with Andrew Birch
- **Commsverse 2025 & 2026**: Confirmed regular speaker
- **LoopUp Webcasts**: Hosted a 6-part webinar series covering Teams telephony, Operator Connect, Copilot integration, and more

### Media & Publications
- **Authority Magazine** (May 2025): Full feature on "The Future of Communication Technology"
- **AI TechPark** (September 2025): In-depth interview on AI and cloud telephony
- **NODE Magazine** (September 2025): Featured article on global telephony challenges

### Blog Posts (zachb.uk)
Extensive coverage including:
- Is Teams Premium Worth It?
- Direct Routing Troubleshooting tools
- SMS Coming to Microsoft Teams Phone
- Voice Isolation in Microsoft Teams
- Queues App features (Monitor, Whisper, Barge, Takeover)
- Voice Enabled Channels
- Dynamics 365 Contact Center
- Multiple Numbers Assigned to Users
- Blocking Numbers Tenant-Wide

### Personal Touches
- **Favourite Quote**: "The Dude abides" (from The Big Lebowski) — he references Zen principles and using it to accept life's challenges
- **Philosophy**: Emphasises continuous learning, work-life balance, networking, not fearing failure, and the importance of soft skills
- **New Dad**: Welcomed a baby girl in early 2025 (announced return from paternity leave in March)

### Community Tools
- **teamstts.com**: Built this tool for the community to test Text-to-Speech for Auto Attendants and Call Queues before deploying — uses the same voices Microsoft Teams uses on the backend

Would you like me to update the draft with any of these additional details?

input.content:
# MVP Celebration - Zach Bennett

**Type**: blog
**Word Count**: ~500

## Brief

Celebrate the achievements of Zach Bennett, Microsoft Teams MVP and Principal Architect at LoopUp.

## Key Points to Highlight

### Professional Background
- **Current Role**: Principal Architect at LoopUp, a leading Cloud Telephony provider (operates in 100+ countries)
- **MVP Status**: Microsoft Teams MVP — one of only 18 in the UK — recently renewed for another year (July 2025)
- **Education**: Computer Science degree from Manchester Metropolitan University
- **Early Career**: Placement year at General Electric; started career managing Cisco phone systems before transitioning to Microsoft technologies
- **Experience**: Over a decade in Microsoft unified communications (UC) and voice solutions
- **Career Evolution**: Moved from Cisco → Microsoft development work → Skype for Business deployments → Microsoft Teams Phone specialist

### Specialisation & Expertise
- Microsoft Teams Phone deployments for global enterprises
- Operator Connect and Direct Routing via LoopUp Cloud Telephony Platform
- Migrating organisations from legacy PBX systems to cloud-based telephony
- Microsoft licensing optimisation, security, and modern workplace capabilities
- Global telephony strategy for multinational enterprises

### Thought Leadership & Community Contributions
- **Personal Blog**: zachb.uk — covers Teams Premium, Direct Routing troubleshooting, SMS features, Voice Isolation, Queues App, and more
- **YouTube Channel**: Tutorials on Call Queues, Auto Attendants, and Teams Phone features
- **Community Tool**: Built teamstts.com — a free Text-to-Speech tester for Teams Phone Auto Attendants and Call Queues
- **LinkedIn Articles**: Regular technical articles on Teams Phone features, blocking numbers, multiple user numbers, etc.

### Speaking Engagements
- **Comms vNext 2024 (Denver, CO)**: "Is Teams Ready To Be Your Contact Center?" — his first major international speaking engagement
- **Commsverse 2025 (UK)**: Regular speaker at the Microsoft Teams Conference
- **Microsoft Ignite 2025 (San Francisco)**: Presented "Unlock MS Teams Phone Globally; Insights from World's Leading Brands" (co-presented with Andrew Birch)
- Confirmed speaker for **Commsverse 2026**

### Media Features & Interviews
- **Authority Magazine** (May 2025): "The Future of Communication Technology"
- **AI TechPark** (September 2025): Interview on AI and cloud telephony
- **NODE Magazine** (September 2025): "Breaking Free from Geographically Bound Telephony"
- **LoopUp Webcasts**: Hosted 6-part webinar series on Teams telephony including episodes on Operator Connect, Copilot integration, and user empowerment

### Personal Philosophy
- Favourite quote: "The Dude abides" (from The Big Lebowski) — reflects acceptance of life's challenges
- Values continuous learning, work-life balance, and soft skills alongside technical expertise
- Grateful to mentor Graham Cropley (Head of Global Consulting at LoopUp) for career guidance
- Passionate about teaching and sharing knowledge with the community

### Personal Life
- Recently became a father (baby girl, announced March 2025)
- Based in the UK

## Style Hints

casual, friendly, personal

## Tone

Celebratory, warm, highlighting both professional achievements and community contributions. Show he's relatable — someone who went from uni placement to industry-leading MVP through passion and hard work.

input.content:
# Celebrating Zach Bennett: Our Very Own Microsoft Teams MVP

We're absolutely thrilled to shine a spotlight on someone who's been making serious waves in the Microsoft Teams community — our Principal Architect, Zach Bennett.

For those who don't know, Zach was recently renewed as a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) in Microsoft Teams. And here's the thing — he's one of only 18 Teams MVPs in the entire UK. That's not just a fancy title; it's recognition from Microsoft themselves that Zach is one of the go-to voices helping shape how organisations around the world use Teams Phone.

## From Cisco to Cloud Telephony Champion

Zach's journey is one of those brilliant "follow your passion" stories. He studied Computer Science at Manchester Metropolitan University, and during his placement year at General Electric, he had a realisation that would shape his career: the big corporate life wasn't for him. He wanted somewhere more intimate, where he could wear many hats and really make an impact.

He started out managing Cisco phone systems, but quickly found his true calling in the Microsoft ecosystem — first with development work, then Skype for Business, and eventually discovering his passion in voice deployments. As he puts it: "The telephone totally revolutionized the way we could communicate… What's next?" That forward-thinking mindset has driven everything since.

Now, with over a decade of hands-on experience in unified communications, Zach leads some of our most complex global telephony projects here at LoopUp — helping multinational organisations across 100+ countries migrate from clunky legacy PBX systems to modern Microsoft Teams Phone.

## Building for the Community

What really sets Zach apart is how much he gives back. He doesn't just solve problems for clients — he shares what he learns with everyone.

His blog at zachb.uk has become a trusted resource for Teams admins everywhere, covering everything from whether Teams Premium is worth the investment to Voice Isolation features, the new Queues App capabilities, and the latest Direct Routing troubleshooting tools rolling out in Teams Admin Center.

His YouTube channel walks viewers through practical guides on Call Queues, Auto Attendants, and more. And then there's **teamstts.com** — a tool Zach built entirely for the community. It lets you test what Text-to-Speech will actually sound like in your Auto Attendants and Call Queues before you go live, using the same voices Microsoft Teams uses on the backend. If you've ever had a company name that TTS absolutely butchers, you'll understand why this is such a lifesaver.

## On Stage and Around the World

Zach's passion for teaching extends well beyond the screen. One of his most memorable career moments came at Comms vNext 2024 in Denver, Colorado — his first major international speaking engagement — where he presented "Is Teams Ready To Be Your Contact Center?" to an audience of Microsoft communications professionals from around the globe.

Since then, he's become a regular on the conference circuit. Just last November, he was at Microsoft Ignite 2025 in San Francisco, co-presenting "Unlock MS Teams Phone Globally: Insights from World's Leading Brands" with our own Andrew Birch. He's a fixture at Commsverse (the UK's premier Microsoft Teams conference) and is already confirmed to speak at Commsverse 2026.

He's also been featured across industry publications — Authority Magazine, AI TechPark, NODE Magazine — sharing his insights on the future of enterprise communications and AI-driven telephony.

## The Person Behind the Professional

Here's something you might not know about Zach: his favourite quote is "The Dude abides" from The Big Lebowski. As he explains it, it's about accepting life's challenges, taking things in your stride, and remembering what truly matters. Pretty solid life philosophy, if you ask us.

He's also quick to credit others for his success — particularly Graham Cropley, our Head of Global Consulting, who Zach describes as a constant source of knowledge and encouragement throughout his career. And on the personal front, 2025 has been extra special: Zach recently welcomed a baby girl into the world.

## What's Next?

With Teams Phone continuing to evolve at a rapid pace — AI-powered features, Copilot integration, new admin tools, enhanced call handling — there's never been a more exciting time to be working in this space. And we couldn't be prouder to have Zach leading the charge, both for our clients and for the wider community.

So here's to Zach: MVP, architect, educator, tool builder, new dad, and all-around Teams Phone enthusiast. Congratulations on another well-deserved year of recognition!

---

*Want to follow Zach's work? Check out his blog at [zachb.uk](https://www.zachb.uk), his [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett), or connect with him on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/).*

input.newString:
## What Zach Actually Does (It's a Lot)

As Principal Architect at LoopUp, Zach sits at the heart of our most complex global telephony deployments. This isn't just "set up some phones" work — it's enterprise-scale transformation for multinational organisations operating across 100+ countries.

Day to day, Zach leads the full journey: strategic planning, proof-of-concept design, and multi-site rollouts that can span dozens of countries simultaneously. He works directly with global enterprises to migrate them away from fragmented legacy PBX systems — often a patchwork of regional carriers, each with their own contracts, billing, support teams, and headaches — onto a unified Microsoft Teams Phone platform.

He advises on Microsoft licensing optimisation, security configurations, and modern workplace capabilities, ensuring clients don't just get Teams Phone working, but get the absolute maximum value from it. Whether it's navigating the complexities of Operator Connect, architecting Direct Routing solutions via our Cloud Telephony Platform, or helping organisations tackle tricky markets like China and India, Zach's the one making it happen.

In short: when a Fortune 500 company needs to consolidate their global voice infrastructure and actually make it work seamlessly, Zach's the architect they turn to.

What really sets Zach apart is how much he gives back. He doesn't just solve problems for clients — he shares what he learns with everyone.

His blog at zachb.uk has become a trusted resource for Teams admins everywhere, covering everything from whether Teams Premium is worth the investment to Voice Isolation features, the new Queues App capabilities, and the latest Direct Routing troubleshooting tools rolling out in Teams Admin Center.

His YouTube channel walks viewers through practical guides on Call Queues, Auto Attendants, and more. And then there's **teamstts.com** — a tool Zach built entirely for the community. It lets you test what Text-to-Speech will actually sound like in your Auto Attendants and Call Queues before you go live, using the same voices Microsoft Teams uses on the backend. If you've ever had a company name that TTS absolutely butchers, you'll understand why this is such a lifesaver.

## On Stage and Around the World

Zach's passion for teaching extends well beyond the screen. One of his most memorable career moments came at Comms vNext 2024 in Denver, Colorado — his first major international speaking engagement — where he presented "Is Teams Ready To Be Your Contact Center?" to an audience of Microsoft communications professionals from around the globe.

Since then, he's become a regular on the conference circuit. Just last November, he was at Microsoft Ignite 2025 in San Francisco, co-presenting "Unlock MS Teams Phone Globally: Insights from World's Leading Brands" with our own Andrew Birch. He's a fixture at Commsverse (the UK's premier Microsoft Teams conference) and is already confirmed to speak at Commsverse 2026.

He's also been featured across industry publications — Authority Magazine, AI TechPark, NODE Magazine — sharing his insights on the future of enterprise communications and AI-driven telephony.

## The Person Behind the Professional

Here's something you might not know about Zach: his favourite quote is "The Dude abides" from The Big Lebowski. As he explains it, it's about accepting life's challenges, taking things in your stride, and remembering what truly matters. Pretty solid life philosophy, if you ask us.

He's also quick to credit others for his success — particularly Graham Cropley, our Head of Global Consulting, who Zach describes as a constant source of knowledge and encouragement throughout his career. And on the personal front, 2025 has been extra special: Zach recently welcomed a baby girl into the world.

## What's Next?

With Teams Phone continuing to evolve at a rapid pace — AI-powered features, Copilot integration, new admin tools, enhanced call handling — there's never been a more exciting time to be working in this space. And we couldn't be prouder to have Zach leading the charge, both for our clients and for the wider community.

So here's to Zach: MVP, architect, educator, tool builder, new dad, and all-around Teams Phone enthusiast. Congratulations on another well-deserved year of recognition!

---

_Want to follow Zach's work? Check out his blog at [zachb.uk](https://www.zachb.uk), his [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/@zachbennett), or connect with him on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zachjbennett/)._
